notes: Effective Jan 1 2025, California SB 1107 raised minimum liability limits from 15/30/5 to 30/60/15.
Texas minimum liability limits are 30/60/25 (BI per person / BI per accident / PD per accident).

Florida operates under a no-fault system. BI liability is not universally required, but 10/20/10 is the typical minimum BI/PD limit where applicable, alongside $10,000 PIP and $10,000 property damage liability.
New York minimum liability limits are 25/50/10; state also requires $50,000 PIP and UM coverage at or above liability minimums.
Illinois minimum liability limits are 25/50/20 (BI per person / BI per accident / PD per accident).
Pennsylvania minimum liability limits are 15/30/5 and the state requires at least $5,000 in first-party medical/PIP benefits.
Michigan’s statutory minimum liability limits are 50/100/10; drivers may default into higher BI options after reform.
North Carolina’s minimum liability limits increase from 30/60/25 to 50/100/50 for policies effective July 1, 2025 and later.
